items.title: Markets Slump as Greenland, Japan Fears Shake Up Torpid Trading
items.summary: As financial markets settled into an unusual state of tranquility, with stocks slowly grinding higher week after week and bond yields hovering in narrow ranges, many on Wall Street started to prepare for a sudden jolt.

items.title: Blackstone Said to Weigh $5 Billion-Plus Sale of Beacon Offshore
items.summary: Blackstone Inc. is in the early stages of weighing a sale of Beacon Offshore Energy, a Gulf of Mexico driller it’s owned for about a decade that could fetch more than $5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Ex-BHP Executive to Become Minister as Chile Seeks Copper Boost
items.summary: A former BHP Group executive will become Chile’s next mining minister, taking charge of efforts to expand copper and lithium production in the country with the largest reserves in the world of both metals.

items.title: Jio BlackRock AMC attracts 10 lakh investors, 18% first-time participants
items.summary: The joint venture between Jio Financial Services and BlackRock has also seen strong participation from investors beyond major metros, with 40% of its retail investors coming from B-30 cities, significantly higher than the industry average of 28%

items.title: Arohan Financial Services plans to hit capital market during middle of 2026-27 with ₹1,500 crore IPO
items.summary: The company has already appointed merchant bankers and hopes to file the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI in the next two months

items.title: Banks go slow on low-yield lending
items.summary: Several Indian banks are modifying their lending approaches in response to current market dynamics. Federal Bank and Yes Bank have reduced their retail lending activities, particularly focusing on housing loans which typically offer lower returns. They are also scaling back loans to large corporations that are seeking favorable interest rates.

items.title: Road map in works for $100 billion textile and apparel exports by 2030
items.summary: India plans to significantly boost textile exports to $100 billion by 2030. The strategy involves increasing shipments to Free Trade Agreement partners and focusing on premium products like handlooms and silk. New districts will be developed to join the export ecosystem. This initiative aims to expand India's global market share in textiles.

items.title: Road map in works for $100 billion textile and apparel exports by 2030
items.summary: India plans to significantly boost textile exports to $100 billion by 2030. The strategy involves increasing shipments to Free Trade Agreement partners and focusing on premium products like handlooms and silk. New districts will be developed to join the export ecosystem. This initiative aims to expand India's global market share in textiles.

items.title: Warner Bros. Forecasts Declining Sales, Profit for Cable Unit
items.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. is projecting declining revenue and profit over the next five years for its cable networks, which the company plans to spin off before selling the streaming and studios business to Netflix Inc.

items.title: Budget 2026: Incentives likely for carbon capture, utilisation & storage tech
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's government is exploring incentives for carbon capture technology in the upcoming FY27 Budget. This move aims to reduce emissions from crucial sectors like power, steel, and cement. The CCUS program, with a significant government allocation, is planned in phases. This technology is vital for India's energy security and its commitment to net-zero emissions by 2070.

items.title: Renewable energy minister Pralhad Joshi invites IKEA owner for green tie-up
items.summary: During a pivotal moment at Davos, India's Renewable Energy Minister Pralhad Joshi stressed the importance of international partnerships to fuel the nation's clean energy revolution. The Ingka Group, known for its IKEA brand, demonstrated an eager commitment to invest in India's growing solar, wind, and hybrid energy markets.

items.title: ITC Hotels Q3 net profit rises 9.6% to ₹237 crore
items.summary: During the quarter under review, ITC Hotel's revenue from operations stood at ₹1,230.68 crore compared to ₹1,015.40 crore, a regulatory filing showed

items.title: India FTA to create market of 2 billion people: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen
items.summary: The European Union is on the brink of a landmark trade agreement with India, potentially linking a consumer base of two billion individuals. In a bid to strengthen these negotiations, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is scheduled to visit India shortly. This strategic move reflects the EU's goal of broadening its global trade horizons and fostering international collaboration.

items.title: S&P 500 drops over 1% on Trump's tariff threat to EU allies over Greenland
items.summary: President Trump's escalating tensions with European leaders over Greenland led to a drop in S&amp;P 500, which fell over 1%, marking its largest morning decline since April.&nbsp;

items.title: When chocolate turns costly, India picks candy: Local players dent giants like Mars, Mondelez & Hershey amid cocoa price surge
items.summary: Major global candy makers saw their slowest India sales in years during FY25. Record cocoa prices forced price increases, pushing shoppers to cheaper options. Hundreds of local companies offered hard candies with big discounts. This competition and rising costs impacted sales for big brands. However, demand is now improving as input costs decrease.

items.title: Inspira Global to buy controlling stake in Burger King India operator RBA
items.summary: The investment will be made through Inspira’s food and beverage arm, Lenexis Foodworks

items.title: Skoda bets on India growth story; looks to expand product range, diversify export markets
items.summary: Czech automaker Skoda is set to expand its India operations. The company plans to introduce new models, including an electric car, and boost its SUV lineup. Skoda also aims to use its Indian manufacturing base to export vehicles to global markets, particularly Europe, following a potential free trade agreement with the EU.

items.title: BCCI inks  ₹270-crore sponsorship deal with Google's Gemini ahead of 2026 IPL
items.summary: The BCCI has signed a  ₹270-crore sponsorship deal with Google's AI platform Gemini for the 2026 IPL. Here's what we know so far.&nbsp;

items.title: Anthropic CEO slams US nod for Nvidia AI chip export to China, compares it with ’selling nuclear weapons to North Korea'
items.summary: Anthropic's CEO warned that the Trump administration's decision to allow Nvidia to sell advanced AI chips to China could enhance China's AI capabilities, posing significant risks.&nbsp;

items.title: LTIMindtree, Persistent lead mid-cap revenue as regulatory costs hit bottom lines in Q3
items.summary: While demand for data modernization and manufacturing tech remains high, both IT services firms faced significant margin pressure due to India’s new labour codes.

items.title: Rallis India Q3FY26 profit falls 81% on exceptional gratuity provision

items.title: RBI approves appointment of Kaizad Bharucha as whole-time director in HDFC Bank
items.summary: HDFC Bank announced a significant development today. The Reserve Bank of India has given its approval for Kaizad Bharucha's re-appointment. He will continue as the Whole-time Director, also known as Deputy Managing Director, for another three years. This term will commence from April 19, 2026.

items.title: Zydus Lifesciences eyes acquisition of US firm Ardelyx for $2.5 billion
items.summary: Zydus Lifesciences plans to acquire a majority stake in Ardelyx Inc. for $2.2-2.5 billion, funding the deal through a  ₹5,000 crore equity raise. This acquisition aligns with Zydus's strategy to expand into innovative medicines amid growing competition.

items.title: United Spirits Q3 Results: Cons PAT jumps 25% YoY to Rs 418 crore; net sales up 8%. Rs 6 per share dividend announced
items.summary: United Spirits reported a 25% year-on-year increase in its December quarter consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 418 crore. Revenue from operations saw a nearly 3% rise to Rs 7,942 crore. The company also announced an interim dividend of Rs 6 per equity share.

items.title: Four more sectors brought under greenhouse gas reduction regime: Environment Ministry
items.summary: The reductions are expected to be in accordance with the Greenhouse Gases (GHG) Emission Intensity Target Rules, 2025.

items.title: Govt cuts raw jute stock limits as prices rise above MSP, traders and mills face stricter norms
items.summary: The Centre has tightened raw jute stock limits for traders, balers and mills after prices rose sharply above MSP, citing hoarding and supply concerns. The move mandates fortnightly disclosures, strict compliance timelines and tough penalties to stabilise the jute market.

items.title: US bank stocks fall as investors await credit card rate cap deadline
items.summary: U.S. bank stocks fell in ‍morning trading on Tuesday in a broader market decline ​as investors waited to see if the Trump administration's January 20 deadline to implement a 10% cap ⁠on credit card interest rates would take effect.

items.title: Big Push for South Delhi Infra: Rs 1,400-crore six-lane elevated road approved; key details inside
items.summary: According to the CMO, the elevated road will stretch for about 5 kilometres, connecting Saket G Block to Pul Prahladpur. The total expenditure for the project has been projected to be Rs 1,471 crore. The construction is probably going to start very soon, and the deadline for its conclusion has been set for December 2027.

items.title: White House marks Trump's one year in office as Democrats slam ‘tariff-ravaged’ economy
items.summary: US President Donald Trump was sworn in on January 20, 2025, becoming only the second US president to serve non-consecutive terms.

items.title: Moderna shares up 2% as skin cancer vaccine shows sustained benefit in five-year follow-up
items.summary: Moderna and Merck said on Tuesday their ⁠experimental personalized vaccine continued to cut the risk of death or recurrence of the most deadly skin cancer five years after the treatment started.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
items.summary: Indian markets stayed cautious amid uncertainty over US tariff rulings, persistent FII outflows, rising global bond yields and a weaker rupee. Nifty technicals stayed bearish near 200-DMA, with mid and small caps underperforming ahead of earnings and global cues developments.

items.summary: U.S. IT hardware ‍stocks dropped on Tuesday ​after Morgan Stanley downgraded the sector, warning of slowing ⁠demand as companies rein in spending amid economic uncertainty and rising component costs.

items.title: Vehicle transfer NOC only after all pending national highway user fee dues cleared
items.summary: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has amended the Central Motor Vehicles Rules, 1989, to ensure unpaid user fees are cleared before vehicle ownership transfers, fitness certificate renewals, or national permit issuance. These changes aim to improve fee compliance and discourage evasion on National Highways, especially with the upcoming Multi-Lane Free Flow tolling system.

Realizing green steel ambitions depends on economics, technology, and policy.

The changes aim for a more robust dividend distribution framework for the banking sector.

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
items.summary: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
